SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.compendium.core.db.management
Class DBRestoreDatabase

java.lang.Object
  com.compendium.core.db.management.DBRestoreDatabase
All Implemented Interfaces:
DBConstants, DBProgressListener, java.io.Serializable
public class DBRestoreDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
implements DBConstants, DBProgressListener

This class restores the data in a given sql file into the named database. It allows external classes to register DBProgressListeners and fires appropriate progress information to them. This facilitates the display of progress information in a user interface, if desired.

Author:
Michelle Bachler
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DBRestoreDatabase

public DBRestoreDatabase(int nDatabaseType,
                         DBAdminDatabase admin,
                         java.lang.String sDatabaseName,
                         java.lang.String sDatabasePassword,
                         java.lang.String sDatabaseIP)
This constructor takes a name and password to use when accessing the database, and the IP address of the server machine.

Parameters:
nDatabaseType, - the type of the database being used (e.g, MySQL, Derby).
admin, - the DBAdminDatabase instance to use to register the new database created.
sDatabaseName, - the name to use when creating the connection to the database.
sDatabasePassword, - the password to use when connection to the database.
sDatabaseIP, - the IP address of the server machine. The default if 'localhost'.
Method Detail

restoreDatabase

public boolean restoreDatabase(java.lang.String sName,
                               java.io.File file,
                               boolean fullRecreation)
Restore the data in the passed file to the database with the given name.

Parameters:
String - sName, the name of the database to restore to.
File - file, the file holding the sql statements to restore from.
boolean - fullRecreation, idicates whether to drop an recreate all tables - not currently used.

restoreDatabaseAsNew

public boolean restoreDatabaseAsNew(java.lang.String sFriendlyName,
                                    java.io.File file,
                                    boolean fullRecreation)
                             throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                    java.sql.SQLException,
                                    DBDatabaseNameException,
                                    DBDatabaseTypeException
Restore the data in the passed File, to a new database with given database name.

Parameters:
String - sFriendlyName, the name of the new database to create and restore to.
File - file, the file holding the sql statements to restore from.
boolean - fullRecreation, idicates whether to drop an recreate all tables - not currently used.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
java.sql.SQLException
DBDatabaseNameException
DBDatabaseTypeException

checkReferencePaths

private void checkReferencePaths(java.sql.Connection con)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Check that all the reference and image path just loaded have the correct file separators fot the current platform. Update the data where required.

Parameters:
Connection - con, the connection to the database to use to restore the data.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

loadData

private boolean loadData(java.sql.Connection con,
                         java.io.File file)
Load and restore the data in the given File, using the given Connection.

Parameters:
Connection - con, the connection to the database to use to restore the data.
File - file, the file object to get the sql statements from to restore the data.
Returns:
boolean, true if the restoration was successful, else false.

checkVersion

private java.lang.String checkVersion(java.io.File file)
Check which version of the database schema the data to load is from.

Parameters:
File - file, the file object to get the sql statements from to restore the data.
Returns:
boolean, true if the restoration was successful, else false.
